p: BACE-1 inhibitors able to interfere with the inflammation process arose from a thiazolyl-thiadiazine scaffold, which Sagar et al. used to embark with the synthesis of novel MTDLs for AD ( 49, Figure 16) [ 113]. They were inspired by Verubecestat [ 114] and other thiadiazine-1,1-dioxide scaffolds acting as BACE-1 inhibitors, along with thiazole-based compounds useful in reducing acute inflammation status, thus potentially able to interfere with COX activity.
